docs.lead_paragraph: The air is suggestive of falling leaves and dried branches and a scarcity of sap. Nights and mornings are really uncomfortably cool, unless with Winter clothing. The stray citizens are returning home in bevies; fresh, ruddy, sunbu??t, merry, and poorer in pocket, though rich in health and good humor.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEATH OF A SOLDIER OF THE REVOLUTION. --EDENBZER LANDON, one of the very few of that gallant band to whose devotion, gallantry and sufferings we are indebted for the blessings of freedom, died at Sharon Springs on the 23d inst. Mr. LANDON was born at Linchfield, Conn., in the year 1760, and was, therefore, at the time of his decease, in the 94th year of his age.

headline.main: OUR STATE PRISONS.; THE WAYS AT ONE OF THEM. Explanatory and Intoxicating.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anxious as I am to give nothing but what is strictly true, I hasten to make the following explanation. In my first letter, I made mention that according to the testimony given, there were on the Prison shop-book no charges made for the paint and nails used on the gates made for Dale Cemetery, in the Prison carpenter shop.

docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH OR SAVANNAH.--Up to Thursday night, 24th, there was no abatement in the sickness which has been prevailing in the sickness which has been prevailing in our city during the last week. Among the deaths of yesterday, it is with sincere pain that we announce that of Mr. BERRIEN B. M. BURROUGHS, of the from of J. H. BURROUGHS SON.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the full returns made this day to the Board of Health, they have the cases of cholera in this city since their last report are few in number, and very much mitigated in character, and that the city is now as free from disease as it ordinarily is at this season of the year.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the Governor Dudley we have papers and letters from our Havana correspondent to the 21st inst. The intelligence is net of special interest. The Captain General has issued an order giving to MAMUEL CRISTOBEL DE ZAYES, of the Department of Mariei, the reward of $1,294, for having recovered a number of negroes introduced into the Island, contrary to law, by the American brig Grey Eagle.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Washington Union of the present week, we see the offical announcement of the appointment of JOHN McCLINTOCK as Naval Officer at the Custom-House, Portsmouth, N.H. Capt. McCLINT CK'S term of office expires under his old appointment this day, and on Monday next he enters on his ninety-fourth year, and on the discharge of the duties of his new four years' commission.

headline.main: LONG ISLAND.; Beheeban, the Murderer of the Wiekham Family THE LONG ISLAND MURDER.

docs.lead_paragraph: Appearance of the Culprit--Precautions--Time for Trial--The Attorney General ?? Prosecute--Hopeless Attempt to prove an ??. The perpetrator of the revolving murder of Mr. and Mrs. WICKHAM, at the village of Cutchogue, Long Island, will soon be arraigned before the legal authorities of Suffolk County, to answer the awfull crime with which he is charged.
